2969523E42944300A1566993289F4B2E.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

E46B4A2038044C168977EB576F45D248.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

7DFA5C4F537A406CA58998C8BB3AE9CB.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

188BB3BE0A354750975608CD64AF2875.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals

B5D08A8C08734A638DB5271B0655FFF2.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

17048B181E8D42EF80A0EC4A73C9F6E5.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

2E64B1930F0D44BA87E3EFBD80C03F8E.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

6E0A0B56DDE04A95A74AFBCE83709A5B.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

8A2CA667A65F43D180530B9D8B0B89A4.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

2DC3000C359E4E42BF7DBC15519D198C.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

0063E86DF2B243DC8694A530D24A4220.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

167A3896495049AE96561CD5E2472C44.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

4E6406C37D56404B943731941E3631AF.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

B6CA290B52024D39B8DD2AE7F33A5192.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor? What should I wear?,  When will I be provided with safety training? What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?. What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

5DDF10DA473146FA96C005AADDD36568.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

098CFD65DCB345E1BC2972FA21F8D92B.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

DFD76221C81041339AD1D502B2D220B0.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

AD324A546A6F48BEA7C9D506E6C0B9E3.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

F81D0D29B9EB4D9CAAA7E3EB2116805D.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

280D53AD4A6A4515847513A935F36732.description: Review the accounting cycle for a merchandising business.

5FD9393500D84B5787CCAED75812C635.description: Examine the inquiry question: How do the accounts of a merchandising business differ from a service business?

8297392BD06540C7A0F3B39B5080B701.description: Perform the financial responsibilities necessary to implement a chosen accounting system.

E4774B6B2A80415FA739294A35E9F5D6.description: Organize and plan an accounting system that could be implemented given a set of a real life numerical examples such as phone bill, utility bills, business license, or rent.

EE01E98E84854F49892BD94BFB889D77.description: Examine accounting practices through a project simulation related to a merchandising business.

47906BA2EFE14BEEB2B5123BBA838FEC.description: Prepare journal entries for the disposal of fixed assets which have an accumulated depreciation account, calculating for each situation, disposing for a gain, a loss and at book value

9B7DF38C1B334F8B8AA90D76B247A7B7.description: Explore and differentiate methods such as declining- balance, sum-ofthe-years digits, production-unit method and capital cost allowance for calculating depreciation.

15A00BD4ABBC4FF7B61499C731AEDD3A.description: Compute the amount of estimated depreciation expense and prepare journal entries using the straight-line method of depreciation for full and partial years.

EE6F5F4D959F422B99A0D5EBE2F60D33.description: Identify accounting concepts, principles and practices (e.g., historical cost, matching revenue expenses, obsolescence, salvage value, book value) related to fixed assets.

85A10DE23EEB40368A0B81BDBD79F459.description: Examine depreciation of fixed assets through journals and fixed asset records.

F221F0EE4FE94DE7A16A093EFC1EFCBF.description: Explain the purpose of the allowance method for recording losses from uncollectible accounts.

083DFAE5F01E47258693CF73CFB920CA.description: Differentiate between a write-off and a direct write-off.

D4B7FF8BE9304C44A606D7F0145605A6.description: Define write-off using the allowance method and direct write-off.

DCC1D5EC1F5847BA9E66288FC88F2933.description: Examine bad debts expense using the allowance method.

6F61BF21720844F38F49BE5194E43A3E.description: Assess the impact of the GAAPs (e.g., historical cost, adequate disclosure, matching revenue with expenses, consistent reporting) on what is reported on financial statements.

841157CF986F4BECA9E1C111EB81DCAF.description: Explore the inquiry questions: Who is interested in the accurate calculations of assets? Is it practical to aim for no bad debts in every situation? What impact does Canada Revenue Agency have on the amount of bad debt a company may claim?

5188A72C34CC463185A1DB80899A22FC.description: Discuss how bad debts, depreciation, and inventory valuations assist in assuring that assets are represented as accurately as possible on financial statements.

D63744BB5B904D9E944D9FAD4997493A.description: Define bad debts and depreciation as used within financial statements.

33484799E98F49D1978C0EE2E7653600.description: Generate a list of who (e.g., insurance agencies, Canada Revenue Agency, financial institutions) needs access to financial statements and discuss the purpose of granting access.

70E2D343B7174B54A8CADE58083D4ED9.description: Analyze how financial statements are used when making business decisions related to bad debt.

9E57943C19A94C80B4ABD0AA9F8D5BA8.description: Identify the need for a set of internal cash control procedures for a business to protect against theft, waste and to ensure accurate data.

9E8A830645F449AE98362BFDF364495F.description: Examine banking fraud and its impact on businesses.

2567E00FA9884C0990C6668D0CF4C27B.description: Identify banking services designed for business

01A440C116E340B3B2AB91ABD19AAA9C.description: Justify why detailed payroll records must be maintained.

64A29A265A9C407AB9AEE6E9CA786FC9.description: Itemize payroll components including earnings, compulsory and voluntary deductions.

42668B16065B4D4EB1C5331F07C2FC4A.description: Post the adjusting and closing entries by transferring them from the journals to the general ledger to close the temporary accounts and prepare the business books for the next accounting period.

7ECD322C129246D2820C77E5EC1D36A6.description: Prepare the journal entries for adjusting and closing entries for the end of the accounting period in the general or synoptic/combination journal.

49FB12DE6F4849A49E71BDE34C248EB9.description: Examine and discuss who reads financial statements and why they do.

B3D0601CDC53446E90D33AA47CFF4073.description: Implement steps 4-8 of the accounting cycle for a merchandising business.

D47CE388164447D19BD3704468B54929.description: Post values to the general ledger and subsidiary ledgers such as accounts receivable and accounts payable.

5ECD59E91E6847899F122B714DE7FA9D.description: Execute a multi-journal system and/or an expanded combination journal (e.g., sales, purchases, cash receipts, cash payment) for a scenario/simulation of a merchandising business.

4AE105C2667E41DF8CF7AB58F669D3DF.description: Review and summarize the eight steps in the accounting cycle (i.e., analyze originating transaction data, journalize, post, prepare worksheets, prepare financial statements, journalize and post adjusting and closing entries, prepare post-closing trial balance) for a merchandising business.

C51B330518BB4204A6C736424590F71A.description: Distinguish between the general ledger and the subsidiary ledgers.

CC9EA2D8C9354D1899F1099AF4194C7E.description: Explore the importance of inventory and its accurate value within a merchandising business.

6E3AFE5338C044EFA47347351FC6208F.description: Discuss why different parts of accounting handbook exist (e.g., International Financial Reporting Standards [IFRS], Accounting Standards for Private Enterprises [ASPE], Not –for-profit organizations [NPO], Public Sector Accounting Board [PSAB]).

7AED9C2C5E284DA8B7FA73516682F0D6.description: Collaborate with peers to discuss inquiry questions such as: Why do GAAPs and accounting standards exist? How are the GAAPs applied? What would happen in the absence of any standards?

C6233BF412AD44C9B5179AD016989EE1.description: Evaluate the operation and viability of a merchandising business from an accounting perspective.
